description.narrative: The main development objective of the project is to increase the accuracy of forecasts provided to the Russian people and economy by modernizing key elements of RosHydromet's technical base and strengthening its institutional arrangements. This would enable enterprise and household adjustments to protect lives and support economic growth.

condition.narrative: Disbursement and FM will follow procedures described in Sections C6,D3, Annex7
RHM shall approve a Capacity Building Program Manual acceptable to the Bank for managing the Capacity Building Program.

title.narrative: Data collected and transmitted (including processed information) within Russia or globally does not encounter infrastrucuture bottlenecks in RosHydromet telecoms.

baseline.value: 87% of WMO reporting stations now report data to GTS on time

comment.narrative: Target was revised and values increased during the MTR.

target.value: 92% of WMO reporting stations now report data to GTS on time (this target value was revised based on re-evaluation at MTR)

comment.narrative: End target is achieved by the original closing date and prior to restructuring.

actual.value: 92% of WMO-reporting stations now report data to GTS on time.

title.narrative: Percentage of upper air stations in compliance with WMO requirements

baseline.value: 5% (total of stations) - this value was re-evaluated at MTR

comment.narrative: The baseline target was reevaluated during MTR and augmented.

target.value: 62% (total of stations) - this value was re-evaluated at MTR due to change of baseline

actual.value: 62% of the total number of upper air stations are in compliance with WMO requirements.

title.narrative: Area covered by strong wind alarms and precipitation

baseline.value: strong wind alarms is 0 km2; 300,000 km2 for precipitation

comment.narrative: This target is delinked from project investments after the changes agreed during MTR. The MTR agreed to cancel procurement ofmeteorological radars and to re-allocate “released” funds to other high priority activities.

target.value: 100,000 km2 strong wind storm alarms 500,000 km2 for precipitation

comment.narrative: The GORF is currently implementing an investment program for Doppler radars with own funds.

actual.value: The GORF continues to implement own plan for increased coverage of the area covered by wind alarms and monitoring of precipiationincreases as being agreed in 2007 duing MTR. A Federal Target Program titled "Modernization of uniform system of air trafficorganization in the Russian Federation" is under implementation which aims at strengthening of radar network (up to 75 Dopplerradars are being installed in main airports).

comment.narrative: Doppler radar program is being implemented using funds from RF.

title.narrative: Lead time increases for national and regional weather forecasts.

baseline.value: Regional forecasts at Novosibirsk and Khabarovsk achieve S1=0.7 and anomaly correlation >= 0.9 at 24 hours lead time in loweratmosphere (MSLP)

target.value: Regional forecasts at Novosibirsk and Khabarovsk achieve S1=0.7 and anomaly correlation >= 0.9 at 36 hours lead time in loweratmosphere (MSLP)

actual.value: Regional forecasts at 36 hours lead time in lower atmosphere (MSLP) at end of project.

comment.narrative: Beneficiaries survey shows high level of user's satisfaction.

title.narrative: Computing centers obtain operational forecasts at higher resolution and using ensemble methods.

baseline.value: T170L31 or better resolution is not used for operational forecasts

target.value: T170L31 or better resolution is used for operational forecasts

actual.value: RHM uses a new version of the global weather forecasting technology based on the ensemble method (weather element computation).This resulted into improved quality of middle-term forecasting (for periods up to 10 days)Baseline accuracy (in 2005) by regionaladministrative centre: 1 day – 83-85%, 2 days – 78-81%, 3 days – 73-77%. Accuracy in 2011: 1 day – 92%, 2 days – 89-90%, 3 days –86-87%. Experimental model 3 min/day (parale comupting) is in use.

comment.narrative: End target was achieved by the original closing date September 30, 2010.

title.narrative: Response time drops for requests for archived data.

baseline.value: Typical response time is now 14 days for an average request to the Obninsk data archive

target.value: Average response time for requesters to the Obninsk WDC is 7 days

actual.value: Response time is up to several hours (less than 24 hours) for an average request to the Obninsk data archive – within one workingday, if data of the latest year is used (upon replenishment of the data of the latest year , response time is equal to theindicator for the whole archive). Services are provided via files exchange. The most important thing is that long-term (infinite)survival of data is ensured.
